Add an Emitter to THIS Mesh

Parameters:
[in]emitterName/ Emitter 's name to be added to THIS Mesh
Returns:
: True if the emitter was added. False if the emitter could not be added becase it is not compatible or already existed.

void nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::clipWithBox ( const Vector &  minCorner,
const Vector &  maxCorner,
const bool &  removeGeometryInside 
)

clipWithBox:

Removes THIS mesh's vertices inside (or outside) the box aligned to axes defined by its minimum and maximum corner.

Parameters:
[in]minCorner/ Minimum corner of the clipping box.
[in]maxCorner/ Maximum corner of the clipping box.
[in]removeGeometryInside/ True to remove vertices inside the clipping box. False to remove vertices outside the clipping box.
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::displaceVerticesWithTexture ( const Image &  texture,
const float &  tileU,
const float &  tileV,
const Vector &  displacementScale,
const bool &  computeLocalBase = NL_true,
const bool &  interpolatePixels = NL_true 
)

displaceVerticesWithTexture:

Apply displacement to THIS Mesh's vertices based on texture with XYZ values encoded as RGB.

Parameters:
[in]texture/ Texture with displacement values (8,16,32 bit RGB)
[in]tileU/ Tile factor for texture coordinates in U direction
[in]tileV/ Tile factor for texture coordinates in V direction
[in]displacementScale/ Scale factor for every component of displacement
[in]computeLocalBase/ True to compute a local base and displace vertices along their normals. Normal direction is G component of displacement. False to use world coordinates in RealFlow default coordinates system.
[in]interpolatePixels/ True to apply a bilinear filter to texture.
MultiBody nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::fracture ( const unsigned int &  numberOfPieces,
const unsigned int &  seed 
)

fracture:

Break the mesh into pieces.

Parameters:
[in]numberOfPieces/ Number of pieces after the breaking process.
[in]seed/ Random seed used for the breaking process.
Returns:
: MultiBody with the resulting pieces.

void nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::sdkExport ( void  )

sdkExport:

Writes out all the resources that are active in the export central

void nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::setGeometry ( const ArrSdkVertex &  vertexs,
const ArrSdkFaces &  faces 
)

setGeometry:

Change THIS Mesh's geometry. The new one is given by a list of Vertexes and Faces. The old geometry is removed so the number of new Vertexes and Faces doesn't have to match the previous numbers. The face normals are always recalculated so any value in the face normal introduced by the user is ignored.

Parameters:
[in]vertexs/ Vector of new Vertexes
[in]faces/ Vector of new Faces
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::tessellate ( const NL_DOUBLE &  maxEdgeLength)

tessellate:

Tessellate THIS Mesh's geometry. Given a maximum edge length, mesh is tessellated until every edge is smaller than the passed parameter. Velocity values are interpolated for the new mesh.

Parameters:
[in]maxEdgeLength
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::updateFaces ( const ArrSdkFaces &  Faces)

updateFaces:

Update the current Mesh's Faces with the new Faces ( faces ) given as parameter. The number of Faces given has to be the same than the number of current Mesh's Faces. The Faces's positions have to be specified in local coordinates. The normals are always recalculated so any value in the vertex normal introduced by the user is ignored.

Parameters:
[in]faces/ Vector of new Faces
void nextlimit::rf_sdk::HY_Mesh::updateVertices ( const ArrSdkVertex &  vertexs)

updateVertices:

Update the current Mesh's Vertexes with the new Vertexes ( vertexs ) given as parameter. The number of Vertexes given has to be the same than the number of current Object's Vertexes. This method is useful when you want to deform the object keeping the Object 's face connectivity. The normals are always recalculated so any value in the vertex normal introduced by the user is ignored.

Parameters:
[in]ref/ Coordinates reference in which the new Vertexes are given:
  • ref values in [ REF_GLOBAL( global coordinates ), RF_LOCAL ( local coordinates ) ]
  • ref default value = REF_GLOBAL
[in]vertexs/ Vector of new Vertexes
